ovdesc.p: This application will allow user to set up different types of events that will be included in the corporate actions/benefits processing suite of programs. In this application, for each event user can specify whether an event will simply pay cash, issue new securities, consist of a combination of both or allow the user to pick different options for a particular portfolio.

This field will be used to specify the rounding rule to be used in the nominal calculation for the redenomination of the security. Flag to indicate whether any securities will be issued by the diary event which it is being defined.

If this field is set to 'Y' then the Corporate Actions being defined in the DIARY.TYPE record is a Rights type Corporate Action. That is holding a particular security on the Ex Div Date will result in the portfolio being credited with a number of tradable items which can then be bought or sold up to the Pay Date of the Event. On the Pay Date of the Event the Rights will be converted to another security - usually at a fixed cost per right.

If this field is set to 'Y' then for the duration of the event (between ex-div date and pay date) any SEC.TRADE or SECURITY.TRANFER done by a portfolio in the Rights stock will be recorded on the ENTITLEMENT record in the SEC.TRADE.ID, BUY.NUMBER and SELL.NUMBER fields and the amount of stock movement will be taken into account when the final Rights holding is converted on pay date.
Allowed values are 'Y'ES/'N'O only. Mandatory input.
This field will indicates the number of days after the Ex date for which transaction indicators will be checked to see if they have been traded 'cum'.
NB the number of days specified includes the "ex" date
A number followed by either C or W to indicate either calendar or working days respectively.
Flag to indicate whether any free securities are offered by the diary event which is being defined.
If this field is set to 'NO' and there are securites credited to the portfolio then T24 will assume there is a price associated with them.
For example this should be set to 'Y' for a Bonus or a Stock Dividend Corporate Action and 'N' for a Call Payment or Warrant Conversion.
Allowed values are 'Y'ES/'N'O only.

This field allows the DIARY.TYPE as one that is subject to tax or not.
If this field is set to 'YES' then the Entitlement records created for this DIARY.TYPE will be subject to tax on any cash credits.
If it is 'NO' then the Entitlement records will not be subject to Tax.

YES/NO field controlling whether the system will automatically assign any unused entitlement to the cash option of this type of Corporate Action.

For some types of multiple option corporate actions (such as a SCRIP Dividend) there will be one - or more - options where the portfolio receives securities and an equivalent cash option. If this flag is set to YES then the user can select the option they require and any unused holdings (due to the terms of the offer, rounding etc.) will automatically be used for the cash equivalent. If this field is NO then selecting a particular option will cause the system to use all the holdings on that option, even if there may some part of the holding unused.
Only YES or NO allowed.
Mandatory field.

Determines whether pre confirmation advices are required by default for this diary type.
The default value will be used to update DIARY and ENTITLEMENT records created for this diary type.
The default values can be modified at the DIARY and ENTILEMENT level.
A value of YES will result in a pre confirmation advice being sent for each entitlement record as it is created either on hold or as an unauthorised record.
The activity code for a pre confirmation advice as defined on EB.ACTIVITY is SC-0100.
If the unauthorised record is subsequently amended or deleted then a pre confirmation amendment advice will be generated, with activity code SC-0101.
The data handed of to the delivery module, which can be used to produce customised advices, is as follows

Record2 - the ENTITLEMENT record
Record3 - the DIARY record
Record4 - the SEC.ACC.MASTER record
Record5 - the SECURITY.MASTER Master record

Record9 can be updated via a user-developed routine as defined in USER.ROUTINE on the relevant EB.ADVICES record.
N.B. field 3 of record 8 will contain the PRINT.FORMAT value of the relevant EB.ADVICES record.

This field should be used to specify , whether the system should post any unused
entitlement amount of this type of Corporate Action to the customer or to the Bank.
To specify which, you should enter either "B", indicating Bank, or "C", indicating customer.
This field defaults to CUSTOMER if CASH.REMIAN is set to 'Y'ES.
(1) Becomes mandatory field when CASH.REAMIN is set to 'Y'ES but will default to CUSTOMER.

This field will control whether or not this corporate action requires Equalisation processing.

Equalisation is the accrued income included in the price of units purchased during the distribution period which is refunded as part of a unitholder's first distribution on those units. The accrued income is averaged over the distribution period, resulting in the same rate of distribution (including equalisation) on all units. Equalisation is, therefore, a capital repayment and is not liable to Income Tax and must be deducted from the cost of the units for Capital Gains Tax purposes.
Optional
Only input of YES or No are allowed
Default to NO
Can be YES only when the following fields are set as follows :-
RIGHTS is not Y
OPTIONS is not Y
REINVEST is not Y
SECURITY.UPDATE is not Y
CASH is Y

For some Demergers or Spin Offs the original holding is retained but the cost of the original position is apportioned across the resulting securities (including the original holding which will have its cost of position reduced) according to the market value of each resultant holding at the time of the authorisation of the ENTITLEMENT record. If this type of book cost apportionment is required the this field should be set to 'YES'.

New field that will control the level at which the ROUNDING takes place. This will be an optional field. Valid input will be 'CUSTOMER', 'DEPOSITORY'. The default will be 'CUSTOMER'.

At the 'DEPOSITORY' level, the rounding can be 'STANDARD' or 'DOWN'. The 'STANDARD' option means a standard adjustment. The 'DOWN' option allows pro-rating the unallocated securities and cash remaining to customers with fractions.
Valid inputs are 'CUSTOMER' or 'DEPOSITORY'
Default will be 'CUSTOMER'

Defines the flow generated by this event . The various types of flows are :
1. WCF - This stands for weighted Cash flow . This Cash flow is defined in the transaction as Z type flow. This flow is used for adjusting the average invested capital.
2. NCF - This stands for Net Cash flow. This Cash flow is defined in the transaction as an 'S' type flow . This represents a Silent flow.
3. NONE - This is a NON CASH flow . The cash flow field is not updated for this type of an event.
4. BOTH - This type of event is a normal cashflow , that is it is defined as 'Y' type flow in the TRANSACTION.
